content.question: The cross-price elasticity of demand between goods J and K is <math alttext="negative 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. A 20 percent decrease in the price of good K will result in a

choices.label: 3 percent decrease in the quantity demanded of good K
15 percent decrease in the quantity demanded of good K
6 percent increase in the quantity demanded of good J
12 percent increase in the quantity demanded of good J
60 percent increase in the quantity demanded of good J

content.answer: 60 percent increase in the quantity demanded of good J

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
